Authors:
Alexandre Gon√ßalves dos Santos Silva-Filho, Marcelo A
Sulzbacher, Tine Grebenc, Felipe Wartchow
Title:
Not every edible orange milkcap is a Lactarius deliciosus:
new record of L. quieticolor (sect. Deliciosi) from Brazil
Journal: Journal of Applied Botany and Food Quality
Keywords:
ectomycorrhizal fungi, milkcaps mushoon, rDNA ITS,
Russulaceae, Pinaceae
Abstract:
Species of Lactarius sect. Deliciosi have natural
distribution in north hemisphere, where are popularly known and
appreciated due to culinary use. Field expeditions in Pine plantation in
southern Brazil led to the discovery a milkcap member of this group,
until now unknown. Lactarius quieticolor is reported as a new record
and, for the first time, was found in Pinus taedae plantation. The
species is described, illustrated, and its taxonomy, morphology and
commercial use are discussed. The putative phylogenetic placement of
these taxa was confirmed from ITS sequence analysis.
